bibl.title: The Political Papyrologist: Adolf Grohmann (1887-1977).
bibl.note: A Farewell in Silence. - Prague. - Innsbruck Years. - Questions of Guilt and Accountability. - ""Only Germany's military defeat in 1945 put an end to the increasingly ignoble political career of this academic opportunist.""

bibl.title: Sources and Approaches across Disciplines in Near Eastern Studies. Proceedings of the 24th Congress, Union Européenne des Arabisants et Islamisants, Leipzig 2008

bibl.seg: Lucian Reinfandt, The Political Papyrologist: Adolf Grohmann (1887-1977).

Verena Klemm & Nuha Al-Sha‘ar (edd.), with Lale Behzadi, Stefanie Brinkmann, Sebastian Günther & Martin Jagonak, in cooperation with Beate Backe, Hans-Gerog Ebert, Liza M. Franke, Mareike Koertner & Daniel De Smet, Sources and Approaches across Disciplines in Near Eastern Studies. Proceedings of the 24th Congress, Union Européenne des Arabisants et Islamisants, Leipzig 2008 = Orientalia Lovaniensia Analecta. 215 (Leuven, 2013) pp. 251-269.

A Farewell in Silence. - Prague. - Innsbruck Years. - Questions of Guilt and Accountability. - ""Only Germany's military defeat in 1945 put an end to the increasingly ignoble political career of this academic opportunist.""
